page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: There was a small settlement at Chilton Cantelo at the time of the Norman Conquest. Indeed the Manor was given to the de Canteloup family as a reward for their part in the Conquest. The word Chilton is thought to derive from the word Churls Town which would indicate that it was an inaccessible place set among the marshes where escaped Churls or servants took refuge. The original Domesday book records 28 houses in the village. There are three more today. The moat field in Marston Magna is the site of a Medieval Manor House. The moat was built not for defence but for artistic qualities. There were fish ponds which acted as a source of food for the inhabitants. These were fed by a stream which can be seen today. The next field shows an example of ridge and furrow farming.
